s.text: What is truly optimistic about the Net is the sense of ratios.
And if someone could acquire the land to build a private road beside a public one, we should not begrudge him because he removes some traffic from the common infrastructure.
Substantively, the question he poses at the outset of his letter is one that we should all answer: Why is this space different from any other space?
The blurb on Larry's book speaks of it as a "dark, exhilarating work."
I see the cause of exhilaration but don't have Larry's dark forebodings.
